courts.description:
Opening Times
Court Building will now be open three days per week Mon, Wed & Fri from 9am-4pm.  This is part of a counter service 'pilot' which is set to be reviewed at the end of Sept 2014.
Court Counter will revert to an 'Appointment Only' system on Mon, Wed & Fri with appointments available from 10am-4pm.  In order to book an appointment contact the Dedicated Appointments Team at Burnley Combined Court on 01282 855300

 

Areas of Law
Accrington will now only deal with civil matters (mainly Housing Possessions).  Accrington no longer deal with Children, Divorce, Domestic Violence as of 2nd June 2014.

courts.name: Bedford County Court and Family Court
courts.description:
When attending a county court hearing, please use the Riverside Entrance.

To book an appointment please ring the Court on 0844 8920550

Users with urgent work will be given the next available appointment.

Urgent work is defined as an application or document(s) which meets one of the four criteria below:

  1. It requires judicial intervention within 24 hours
  2. It needs to be issued within 24 hours
  3. It will reach limitation within 24 hours
  4. The party will suffer significant detriment if it is not registered as being received at a particular time or date.

Work types which are generally considered urgent are below. Items must still come within the above definition and urgent work is not limited to this list.

  • Applications to suspend warrants for possession (property) or execution (goods)
  • Applications for non-molestation orders or injunctions
  • Collecting orders/papers for service following an urgent hearing
  • Applications relating to abduction of children
  • Applications relating to removal of children
  • Emergency Protection Orders and Interim Care Orders

Users with routine work will be given an appointment between the hours of 10am - 2pm unless it is urgent. Work types considered routine are:

  • Swearing Statutory Declarations (traffic enforcements only)
  • Swearing an Affidavit
  • Attending for an order for questioning

For any other queries or non urgent work, please write to the local court at the above address or contact the enquiries team on 0844 892 0550

A free Small Claims Mediation Service (subject to suitability) is accessible for customers involved in small claims proceedings. Please telephone the mediation service or email the Mediation Support Officer for further details.

HMCTS is also a supporter of the National Mediation scheme (for Fast and Multi track cases). To find a civil mediation provider visit http://www.civilmediation.justice.gov.uk/.

courts.name: Luton County Court and Family Court
courts.description:
To book an appointment please ring the Court on 0844 8920550

Users with urgent work will be given the next available appointment.

Urgent work is defined as an application or document(s) which meets one of the four criteria below:

  1. It requires judicial intervention within 24 hours
  2. It needs to be issued within 24 hours
  3. It will reach limitation within 24 hours
  4. The party will suffer significant detriment if it is not registered as being received at a particular time or date.

Work types which are generally considered urgent are below. Items must still come within the above definition and urgent work is not limited to this list.

  • Applications to suspend warrants for possession (property) or execution (goods)
  • Applications for non-molestation orders or injunctions
  • Collecting orders/papers for service following an urgent hearing
  • Applications relating to abduction of children
  • Applications relating to removal of children
  • Emergency Protection Orders and Interim Care Orders

Users with routine work will be given an appointment between the hours of 10am - 2pm unless it is urgent. Work types considered routine are:

  • Swearing Statutory Declarations (traffic enforcements only)
  • Swearing an Affidavit
  • Attending for an order for questioning

For any other queries or non urgent work, please write to the local court at the above address or contact the enquiries team on 0844 892 0550

courts.name: Slough County Court and Family Court
courts.description:
Please note: From 7th April Slough County Court operates an appointment only system for the counter, only urgent work will be given an appointment which can be booked by dialling 01753 690 300.  Urgent work is defined as "it requires Judicial intervention, it needs to be issued or it reaches limitation within 24 hours"  It can also include that the party will suffer significant detriment if it is not registered as being received at a particular time or date.
 
Types of work that are consider urgent, but must fall within the 24 hour limit are, but not limited to: 

  • Applications to suspend warrants for possession (property) or execution (goods)
  • Applications for insolvency, Applications for non-molestation orders or injunctions
  • Collecting orders/papers for service following an urgent hearing
  • Applications relating to abduction of children
  • Applications relating to removal of children
  • Emergency Protection Orders and Interim Care Orders

This office deals with payment of fixed penalty tickets issued by North Wales Police, South Wales Police, Dyfed Powys Police and Gwent Police.

We can accept payment by credit/debit card over the telephone or postal payments by cheque/postal order/credit/debit card.

Any enquiries regarding the issue of the tickets should be directed to the Police Force in where the ticket was issued on the numbers listed below.

Any enquiries regarding Fixed Penalty Tickets that have been registered as a Fine should be directed to the Contact/Compliance Centre at Cwmbran on the number listed below.

courts.name: Watford County Court and Family Court
courts.description:
To book an appointment please ring the Court on 0300 123 5577

Users with urgent work will be given the next available appointment.

Urgent work is defined as an application or document(s) which meets one of the four criteria below:

  1. It requires judicial intervention within 24 hours
  2. It needs to be issued within 24 hours
  3. It will reach limitation within 24 hours
  4. The party will suffer significant detriment if it is not registered as being received at a particular time or date.

Work types which are generally considered urgent are below. Items must still come within the above definition and urgent work is not limited to this list.

  • Applications to suspend warrants for possession (property) or execution (goods)
  • Applications for non-molestation orders or injunctions
  • Collecting orders/papers for service following an urgent hearing
  • Applications relating to abduction of children
  • Applications relating to removal of children
  • Emergency Protection Orders and Interim Care Orders

Users with routine work will be given an appointment between the hours of 10am - 2pm unless it is urgent. Work types considered routine are:

  • Swearing Statutory Declarations (traffic enforcements only)
  • Swearing an Affidavit
  • Attending for an order for questioning

For all forms and leaflets, please visit our website www.justice.gov.uk

The County Court Enquiries Centre receive all telephone enquiries for Bedford, Hertford, Luton, St. Albans and Watford County Courts. Telephone calls may be monitored.  The Enquiries Centre Team can be contacted between the hours of 8:30am and 5:00pm Monday to Fridays.  This does not include Weekends, Bank Holidays and certain Civil Service Privilege Days.

The Enquiries Centre Team can:

Provide advice about Court Procedure where this does not involve giving legal advice.
Give case specific information retrievable from the Court’s computer system to legal representatives instructed by litigants or litigants acting in person.
Forward urgent messages to a Court where it relates to a hearing the same day.
